name: Gates
description: Control the flow of water from the reservoir into the penstocks or spillway.

name: Penstocks
description: Large pipes or tunnels that convey water under pressure from the reservoir intake to the turbines.

name: Inlet valve
description: A valve located just before the turbine to control or completely shut off the water flow.

name: Turbine
description: A rotating machine that converts the kinetic and potential energy of water into rotational mechanical energy.

name: Generator
description: Converts the mechanical energy supplied by the turbine's rotating shaft into electrical energy.

name: Automation, control, protection
description: Integrated systems responsible for monitoring, managing operation, and ensuring the safety of the plant equipment.

name: Medium-voltage switchgear
description: Manages and protects the electrical circuits connecting the generator to the step-up transformer within the powerhouse.

name: Power transformer
description: Increases the voltage of the electricity produced by the generator to high levels suitable for efficient long-distance transmission.

name: High-voltage switchgear
description: Located in the switchyard, this equipment controls, protects, and isolates the high-voltage connection between the power plant and the transmission lines.

name: Transmission line
description: A network of conductors and towers used to transport high-voltage electricity from the power plant over long distances.
